intro: Silene huguettiae var. huguettiae, commonly known as the Huguettia's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a perennial species characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Caryophyllaceae family. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high elevations, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
